metadataAttributes.title: Topical Ocular Delivery of NSAIDs
metadataAttributes.authors: Munish Ahuja, Avinash S. Dhake, Surendra K. Sharma, Dipak K. Majumdar
metadataAttributes.keywords: NSAIDs, bromfenac, anti-inflammatory, ophthalmology, topical administration, nanoparticles, COX-2, ocular inflammation, ophthalmic formulations
metadataAttributes.description: Review of NSAIDs in ocular administration, focusing on bromfenac and innovative formulations.
metadataAttributes.categories: Pharmacology, Ophthalmology, Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, Biomedical research
metadataAttributes.mechanism_of_action: Bromfenac selectively inhibits COX-2, reducing prostaglandin production in ocular tissues.
metadataAttributes.physicochemical_attributes: pH around 8.3, use of cyclodextrins, compatibility with polysorbate 80, incompatibility with benzalkonium chloride
metadataAttributes.comparative_efficacy: Bromfenac is 3.7 times more potent than diclofenac and 18 times more potent than ketorolac.
metadataAttributes.clinical_uses: Postoperative inflammation and pain control after cataract surgeries.
